subject: Languages
title: Lingua Francas: Languages of Global Communication
description: A quick win: understand Lingua Francas: Languages of Global Communication.

hook.text: English is today's global lingua franca. Before it, the role belonged to French, Latin, Arabic, and others.

buildup.text: A lingua franca is a shared language used between groups who don't share a native tongue.

discovery.text: Latin served as Europe's lingua franca for over 1,000 years. Swahili serves East Africa today.

twist.text: The term 'lingua franca' originally referred to a pidgin used by Mediterranean traders in the Middle Ages.

climax.text: When a language becomes a lingua franca, it changes too â€” simplifying and absorbing local features.

punchline.text: Every global language changes the world. The world changes it right back.

quiz.question: What is a lingua franca?
options: A shared language used between groups with different native languages
